creditline: Gift of Sue Y.S. Kimm and Seymour Grufferman
description: black and white image; group of three musicians rendered in geometric style
inscription: URC: うたわれよ　わしゃ　はやす {Utawareyo washa hayasu} (Sing, we play the music)
text: Three musicians are performing the Etchū Owara-bushi 越中おわら節, a difficult folk song with dance that is traditionally performed during the Owara Kaze-no-Bon festival, held for the past 300 years on the first three days of September in Yatsuo, Toyama prefecture. The inscription reads “Sing, we play the music” (Utawareyo washa hayasu).
title: Untitled [musicians performing Owara-bushi]
